definitions.definition: An instance of being subtle, a subtle thing, especially a subtle argument or distinction.
definitions.example: The subtleties of this overture are often overlooked.

definitions.definition: An ornate medieval illusion dish or table decoration, especially when made from one thing but crafted to look like another.
definitions.example: At the king's coronation feast, several subtleties were served between main courses.

definitions.definition: The quality of being clever in surreptitious or deceitful behaviour; an act or argument that shows this quality.
A trick that creates a false appearance.
The property of having a low density or thin consistency.
The property of being able to penetrate materials easily.
